text: Prices peaked in Q2 2022, driven by the Russia-Ukraine war, which disrupted crude and natural gas supplies into Europe. Japan LNG spot prices—typically linked to oil benchmarks or traded cargo indices—surged to over $20 per MMBtu during this period due to increased Asian demand and redirected European cargoes. Price normalization began in late 2023, supported by inventory stabilization and demand-side adjustments.
Source: World Bank Commodity Price Data (The Pink Sheet) (Monthly prices in nominal US$), Updated on 02nd April 2025
